column1: The East Moline Chief of Police
column3: said in a statement that the lawsuit was without merit. However
column4: official exculpatory statements given by police officers contradict evidence in several ways. Officer Staes
column5: in his response to the lawsuit
column6: says that the claim that officers exited their car and pointed their weapons at Butler is false. However
column7: Staes' police report from the night of the incident says that both he and Bush pointed their weapons at Butler to give him orders. Additionally
column8: officer Bush says that a claim in the lawsuit that he was carrying a rifle is false. However
